alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 21 at 4:02AM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet for the higher elevations of the Eastern San Juan Mountains, and 6 to 12 inches for the lower elevations of the Upper Rio Grande Valley. Winds gusting as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Upper Rio Grande Valley and Eastern San Juan Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM Tuesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact travelers over Wolf Creek Pass. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft
